replies.bodyText: I think this would cause extra calls to validateAndGetForceLimitPushDown whenever isApplyLimitPushdown is called because of being unable to distinguish between an actual false and the value not being computed yet. It's probably not especially harmful, but it also seems unnecessary.
replies.author: clintropolis

replies.bodyText: Yeah, it's nullable to lazily initialize and cache it. Checking the value of forceLimitPushDown is needed a couple of times during a query. Even though it's not very harmful, I don't see any reason to not cache it.
